entry.title: Blood and Ashes
entry.summary:
Author: lavieboheme0919

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 72,385Chapters: 13/?Kudos: 44

Summary: Several centuries after the Last Battle, the White Tower stands taller than ever—rebuilt, restructured, and reeling from new threats that no one dares name aloud. Saidin has returned, cleansed and chaotic, and the Hall of the Tower seeks control more than balance. When Stiles—a powerful male channeler raised to Aes Sedai—survives a narrow vote in the Hall for flouting Tower law and custom, he’s spared gentling… but not punishment.Bound without consent to Sitters from opposing Ajahs, declared the first Striker since the Age of Legends, Stiles finds himself weaponized by a Tower that fears what it cannot command. But Stiles is not their dog to tame, and the Tower is not as united as it pretends to be. As ancient tensions simmer and forgotten enemies stir, bonds—both sacred and profane—will be tested.This is not the story of the Dragon. This is what comes after.Power without trust. Bonds without love. And one man who will burn down the Pattern before letting them leash him again.Note: There will be some AI-generated art for an important moment from each chapter at the end of each chapter.

entry.title: From Surrogate to Mate: Trust, Loyalty, and Love
entry.summary:
Author: Foxywho93

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,188Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 33

Summary: What started out as a surrogacy contract, turned into something more. A story about trust, loyalty, family, pack… and danger. Stiles Stilinski didn’t expect his life to collapse all at once — losing school, his apartment, even the Jeep that reminded him of his parents. Homeless, broke, and desperate, he walked into Woodland Grove Surrogacy Agency with nothing left to lose. He only wanted a chance to survive. Derek Hale came to the agency looking for someone strong enough to carry his pup. He didn’t expect his instincts to lock on the sarcastic, exhausted human with too-thin wrists and too-bright eyes. But his wolf knew immediately: Stiles was the one. Now Stiles is pulled into the Hale estate — into a world of warmth, loyalty, and pack — a world that insists he belongs even as he struggles to believe it. But whispers turn into threats, and danger follows close behind. Because sometimes fate doesn’t just hand you family. Sometimes it throws you into it claws-first.

entry.summary:
Author: Glitter_Lips

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 119,599Chapters: 34/37Kudos: 40

Summary: Everyone in my story is dead. Alec has been a Beacon Hills resident and a McCall pack member for just over a year, and he’s finally starting to feel comfortable and safe after his near death experience at the hands of Monroe and her hunter army. He doesn’t want to get involved in the war ever again, content to play lacrosse and live his life.But Monroe isn’t finished yet, and she won’t rest until all supernatural people are wiped out for good. Her plans won’t allow Alec to stay uninvolved forever, and his past threatens to catch up with him no matter how badly he had hoped to keep those secrets buried.

entry.title: Werewolf Ettiquette is a Pain in the Ass
entry.summary:
Author: thenerdyindividual

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 52,666Chapters: 10/11Kudos: 534

Summary: An unexpected visitor brings news that a rival Alpha is interested in taking over Beacon Hills. This means that Derek has to travel to Colorado to convince Werewolf Society to deny that petition. Packs with a mated alpha look stronger and more stable, so Derek needs a mate. Or more accurately, he needs someone to pretend to be his mate. Enter Stiles, who is somehow Derek's best option. Etiquette lessons bring them closer together than either of them expected, and the part of Derek that is more wolf than human is starting to take an interest.(Updates Wednesdays)

entry.title: The Ones Who Care
entry.summary:
Author: our_sin

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,090Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 77

Summary: "Derek groans as he wakes, eyes remaining closed and head still laying on the concrete. He doesn’t remember what happened, doesn’t even remember what he was doing before he awoke to his head throbbing. He wasn’t even aware he could hurt like this, he remembers what it was like to have wolfsbane in his system, even electricity slowing him and his healing down. This isn’t that, he’s not even sure if the pain can be qualified anywhere between better or worse than those moments of his awful life."
